post.author: Phobos
post.body:
Quote:
The 790i Ultra can support DDR3 at up to 2000MHz effective.


Found here: http://www.extremetech.com/article2/0,2845,2276865,00.asp

Quote:
Dual Channel Supported
Single Channel Supported
SLI-Ready
1066MHz DDR3
1333MHz DDR3
2000MHz DDR3
EPP Support


Found here: http://www.tigerdirect.com/applications/SearchTools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=3714951&Sku=E145-2036

My question is simple and potentially dumb.

I'm getting DDR3 ram that runs at 1600mhz.

Will the 790i support it?

EDIT

I take it back, it says (3-Way SLI Support) EVGA nForce 790i SLI Mainboard FSB1333 DDR3 PCIe x16 SATA RAID w/ USB2.0,&7.1Audio

Not the 790i Ultra, and not the 790i FTW.

So will THAT be able to run ddr3 ram running at 1600mhz (NOT OC'd)?

post.author: qwertz123
post.body:
even the 790i runs the ram up to 2000mhz, as long as u get some micron based modules; the ultra is just higher binned. but do me a favor and wait another month for nehalem to arrive.

(dont forget the rank count: get 2x1gb and be on the happy side )
